result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephen D. Sporle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Stephen D. Sporle is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Stephen D. Sporle was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber; no objection to serving in Dane County jail.
Court grants defendant a furlough: to be released from jail on 11/30/2016 and return to jail 12/01/2016 by 5 pm.
Concurrent with: all other cases and sentences

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Notice of Certification
*fax'd to the jail @ 3:10 pm*

Defendant Stephen D. Sporle in court with attorney Kyle Robert Reimann.  Defendant Stephen D. Sporle in custody.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to amend Ct 1 to a Misd Bail Jumping.  Ct 2:  dimissed.  Court reviews charges and penalties.  Defendant sworn.  PLQ - colloquy given and knowing waiver accepted.  Joint recommendation:  220 day jail, concurrent with all other cases and sentences, w/ 148 days stipulated credit, Huber and no objection to serving in Dane County; costs.
Atty Reimann requests a furlough until Friday, December 2, 2016, at 5:00 pm.  State objects to the furlough.  Defendant makes statement on request for furlough.  Discussion for and against in regards to current and prior situations.  Court will grant a 24 hour furlough.  Defendant ordered to report back to jail on 12/01/2016 by 5 pm.
